intro: Clintonia nutans var. macrostema, commonly known as the large-stemmed nodding white-flowered plant, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Melanthiaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, grass-like leaves and showy, nodding white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and thrives in well-drained, acidic soils. Its unique floral structure and ecological role make it a valuable component of forest understory ecosystems. The varietal name "macrostema" refers to its relatively large floral stems compared to the typical variety.
